entry.title: Block resetTabStripWithRelatedTabsForId before Tab State Init
entry.content:
It looks like some behavior change around omnibox focus state supplier

is causing resetTabStripWithRelatedTabsForId to be called before the

tab state is initialized. This can cause an IllegalStateException in

PseudoTab#getRelatedTabList(). To avoid this happening block

resetTabStripWithRelatedTabsForId from running until the tab state is

initialized.



There are also other calls to resetTabStripWithRelatedTabsForId that

can happen before the tab state is initialized so the implementation is

downstream of the omnibox observer to act as a catchall.



The TabModelObserver#restoreCompleted implementation will "correct"

for this delay once the TabModel's state is initialized.



Bug: 1449465

Change-Id: I5d3851bfec58e706ef8057695d53bb7fbf858c80

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4667703

Reviewed-by: Fred Mello

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

Code-Coverage: Findit

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1166464}

entry.title: media/gpu/chromeos: CreateGLImageProcessorWithInputCandidates only on ARM
entry.content:
Previously, CreateGLImageProcessorWithInputCandidates() was limited to

ARM platforms, because the feature flag it checked was also limited to

ARM platforms. However the place calling said function was not limited.

Why this didn't cause issues back when the previous change landed is

unclear, but it is causing issues now.



Only call CreateGLImageProcessorWithInputCandidates() on ARM platforms.

On other platforms, return nullptr instead.



Bug: b:231438595, b:258331312

entry.title: arc: Destroy and re-initialize FakeUpstartClient in each test case
entry.content:
In ArcUtilTest and ArcVmClientAdapterTest, the behavior of

FakeUpstartClient is reset on every test case by passing null callbacks

to FakeUpstartClient's set_start_job_cb / set_stop_job_cb.

This CL changes the tests to destroy and re-initialize FakeUpstartClient

on each test case instead, as it will be simpler and more robust against

the internal changes of FakeUpstartClient.



BUG=None

TEST=ash_components_unittest --gtest_filter="ArcUtilTest.*"

TEST=ash_components_unittest --gtest_filter="ArcVmClientAdapterTest.*"



Change-Id: Ib5bc308af94d2edf8811c5a38a440b7af84f77ef

entry.title: Fix crash in SetPauseInitializingGlobalScope()
entry.content:
There were the following two bugs.



- SetPauseInitializingGlobalScope() is called even when

EmbeddedWorkerStatus::STOPPING.



- pause_initializing_global_scope_ was not set to false when

EmbeddedWorkerInstance::ReleaseProcess(). ReleaseProcess() can be

called on errors.

entry.title: Fix IsWarmingUp and IsWarmedUp
entry.content:
Before this CL, even when service worker warm-up was not requested,

IsWarmedUp() could return true in the STARTING status. This CL fixes

this bug. IsWarmingUp() doesn't have bugs, but from this CL, it will

start checking pause_initializing_global_scope() similarly for

consistency.



This bug will skew ServiceWorker.LoadTiming.MainFrame.* histograms.

entry.title: dlp: Add FPNM test for IO block & fix warning
entry.content:
Adds a FPNM browser test for copy or move IO tasks in block mode. It

checks that completing the task with error can notify FPNM to show the

error notification, and that clicking OK on that notification opens a

dialog. For this, FPNM should use existing Files App window if it exists, as this should be the window in which the user started the task (e.g. by copying some files in the app). If no windows are found, FPNM should first open a new instance of the app, and then show the dialog on top.



R=poromov@chromium.org

R=lucmult@chromium.org



Fixed: b:287458625,1458326

entry.title: [ios] Trigger only one event when the pinned state is updated and moved
entry.content:
There are 2 cases for updating the pinned state.



Case 1: Just updating the pinned state and the layout of WebStateList isn't changed.

In this case, WebStateListDidChange API with kSelectionOnly is triggered and `pinned_state_change` is true.



Case 2: Updating the pinned state and moving a WebState as well.

In this case, WebStateListDidChange API with kMove is triggered and `pinned_state_change` is true.



Bug: 1442546

entry.title: [@scope] Support @scope nested within style rules
entry.content:
This CL adds support for nesting @scope inside regular style rules, e.g.



.a {

@scope (& .b) {

& { ... }

}

}



Note that @scope is a little different from other nested group rules

(like @media), because @scope itself acts as the parent *style* rule

for the purposes of evaluating the parent pseudo-class (&) inside the

body [1].



This means the '&' in the @scope's prelude refers to the '.a' selector,

but the '&' in @scope's body refers to the selector in the prelude,

which effectively is '.a .b'.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting/#nesting-at-scope



Bug: 1456435

Change-Id: I6f53566d9e9bde50a888ab3b86dfd6699f004ebd

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4637290

entry.title: [ios] Replace WebStatePinnedStateChanged() with WebStateListDidChange()
entry.content:
This CL replaces WebStatePinnedStateChanged() with WebStateListDidChange(). No behavior changes in this CL.



This CL is a part of refactoring WebStateListObserver API:

Step 1 [Done]: Introduce WebStateListDidChange() and replace WebStateReplacedAt() with it

Step 2 [Done]: Replace WebStateInsertedAt() with WebStateListDidChange()

Step 3 [Done]: Replace WebStateMoved() with WebStateListDidChange()

Step 4 [Done]: Replace WebStateDetachedAt() with WebStateListDidChange()

Step 5 [Done]: Introduce WebStateListWillChange() and Replace Will*() with it

Step 6 [Now]: Migrate WebStateActivatedAt() and WebStatePinnedStateChanged() to WebStateListDidChange()

Step 6-1 [This CL]: Replace WebStatePinnedStateChanged() with WebStateListDidChange()

Step 6-2: Merge 2 API calls: WebStateListDidChange() with kSelectionOnly and kMove.

Step 6-3: Migrate WebStateActivatedAt() to WebStateListDidChange()

entry.title: Stop reading from the provisional ComputedStyle before MPC lookup.
entry.content:
After looking up in the MatchedPropertiesCache, we call IsCacheable()

to check whether we can use the cache or not. However, this function

is really meant to check the cacheability of the finished ComputedStyle,

and we call this on a provisional ComputedStyle, where we only really

care about the TextAutosizingMultiplier and the other fields are

at the default.



Thus, move the TextAutosizingMultiplier check into Find(), and don't

use the provisional ComputedStyle at all in this spot (we store the

autosizing multiplier in the StyleResolverState instead of in the

ComputedStyle). This is another step on the way to simply not having

ComputedStyle until we've been through the MPC lookup.



Change-Id: Ibc977b74431c84d1dd9e01b93497de599c9eecf9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4667265

Reviewed-by: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Commit-Queue: Steinar H Gunderson

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1166406}

entry.title: Fix Swift 5.9 (iOS 17 SDK) warning in UIView extension
entry.content:
This CL fixes a new warning that appears when building with Swift 5.9

(the version used with the iOS 17 SDK/Xcode 15).



The new warning was introduced here:

is a good explanation of the issue.

entry.content:
Now that ResourceFormat usage has been entirely internalized to

SharedImageFormat, the ResourceFormat C++ enum brings no added value

over just using the Mojo enum directly.



A followup CL will rename ResourceFormat to SinglePlanarFormat and move

the mojom for it into an internal/ subdirectory (note that it cannot be

moved into shared_image_format.mojom as the generated SharedImageFormat

mojom file transitively depends on shared_image_format.h due to

typemapping).

entry.title: media/gpu/v4l2: Do not restrict new V4L2 decoders to ARM or ChromeOS
entry.content:
V4L2 decoders use the standard V4L2 interfaces present on all Linux

systems. There is no reason to limit this to just ARM or ChromeOS.

Indeed we already allow building the code for standard Linux.



Also, limiting it to ARM causes build issues when cross compiling on x86

to ARM on Linux, as the v8 snapshot tools are built for x86.



Allow usage of the new V4L2 feature flags on ChromeOS and Linux, and

drop the limit to ARM platforms.



Bug: b:258331312, b:278935312, b:279980150

entry.title: [//media] Allow wrapping of externally-sampled multiplane SI
entry.content:
Just as it is possible to wrap a VideoFrame using legacy SharedImage

into a GL texture iff the VideoFrame is holding 1 texture (i.e., is not

doing per-plane sampling of a multiplanar image), it is possible to wrap

a VideoFrame using multiplane SI into a GLTexture iff the SI is using

external sampling. This CL extends PaintCanvasVideoRenderer to support

this case.



Bug: 1457134

Change-Id: Ieb1c0b5e5c4441301526e6bcb92c12fca27119ac

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4664581

Reviewed-by: Vasiliy Telezhnikov

entry.title: Move CompressionDictionaryTransport related feature flags to network
entry.content:
This CL moves the `kCompressionDictionaryTransportBackend` and

`kCompressionDictionaryTransport` feature flags from blink to network.



This is intended to expose the feature state to the network service.

(The `blink` feature flags are not accessible from the network service.)



During the Origin Trial experiment of the CompressionDictionaryTransport

feature, we want to have a maximum expiration time on dictionary entries

to keep the duration constrained. To know that the feature is enabled

by an Origin Trial token, the network service must be able to check the

state of the `features::kCompressionDictionaryTransportBackend` flag.

(If `features::kCompressionDictionaryTransport` is disabled but

`shared_dictionary_writer_enabled` of the request is true, this means

that the feature is enabled in the Blink side by an Origin Trial token.)



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: I3cfef4fd112ee229a44a17819c320d7c9d4dcfd5

entry.title: Start reading the shared dictionary early
entry.content:
Currently Chromium starts reading the shared dictionary's disk cache

entry when SharedDictionaryNetworkTransaction::ModifyRequestHeaders() is

called. This is after establishing the network connection.

Reading a disk cache entry takes time. So it should start reading the

shared dictionary's disk cache entry early.



This CL introduces SharedDictionaryStorage::GetDictionaryAsync() and

changes the constructor of CorsURLLoader to call it. So that Chromium's

network service can start reading the dictionary as soon as possible.



Also this CL changes CorsURLLoaderFactory::CreateLoaderAndStart() to

get a SharedDictionaryStorage when `shared_dictionary_storage_` is null.

`shared_dictionary_storage_` is null when the CorsURLLoaderFactory is

handling a navigation request because URLLoaderFactoryParams'

`isolation_info` is not set. In that case, we need to get a

SharedDictionaryStorage using the `isolation_info` of the request.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: [@scope] Semicolons should not abort selector parsing for @scope
entry.content:
When parsing rules under CSSNestingType::kScope, we always have some

non-nullptr parent_rule_for_nesting. This would activate special error

handling of semicolons (see AbortsNestedSelectorParsing) within

@scope, which (at least for now) doesn't support declarations directly

within its body (unless it's a nested group rule [1]):



@scope (div) {

z-index: 1;

}



For the above (invalid) case, we'd parse the body using CSSParserImpl::

ConsumeRuleList, which would try to parse 'z-index:...' as a selector

via (ConsumeQualifiedRule). We would then abort at the semicolon,

and then eventually return to ConsumeRuleList, which would re-enter

ConsumeQualifiedRule and immediately abort at the semicolon (and so on).



This CL fixes this infinite loop by adding a separate flag for the

semicolon handling. This makes it possible to parse a list of rules

under CSSNestingType::kScope without also getting that handling.



Also added a DCHECK to make it easier to catch infinite loops

in the future.



Bug: 1456435



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-nesting-1/#nested-group-rules



Change-Id: I9660e98343bdd47522fe87296b1da7112800945a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647597

entry.title: PA: Make `GetPoolAndOffset()` more expressive
entry.content:
Rather than using an anonymous `std::pair`, use a struct with named

members. It doesn't currently make a big difference (and in the fact the

sole user in `reservation_offset_table.h` needs no changing, thanks to

structured bindings).



In a possible future where we may want to get a pool base address out of

an arbitrary address, we would have to switch the `std::pair` to a

`std::tuple` anyway, so it shouldn't hurt to go a more expressive way.

entry.title: [Blink] Guard VideoFrame's per-plane readback of multiplane SI
entry.content:
Just as it is not possible to do per-plane readback with legacy SI if

the number of textures != the number of planes, it is not possible to

do per-plane readback with multiplane SI if doing external sampling. In

both cases we are representing the image by a single *opaque* texture

on the service side. This CL changes webcodec/video_frame.cc to

detect the second case and handle it in the same way as the first case.



Bug: 1457134

entry.title: arc: net: Restrict multicast traffic when not needed (2/2)
entry.content:
Excessive unnecessary multicast traffic would have consequential

impact on excessive CPU usage and shorter battery life.



This patch restrict multicast traffic to ARC when it is unnecessary

under the condition that:

1. Device is not interactive, when network is restricted overall.

2. Multicast lock is not held by any app in ARC when no app shows

interest in multicast traffic, we can stop forwarding multicast traffic

to ARC.



This patch does following things:

Gets notified about change of held status of multicast lock from

ARC and sends the status to patchpanel, for it to decide on whether

to enable/disable multicast forwarder.



Platform side patch: https://crrev.com/c/4421722

ARC side patch: http://ag/22641743



BUG=b:274864026,b:273178045

TEST=tast run arc.DisableUnneededMulticastForwarder.*

out/Default/ash_components_unittests --gtest_filter="*ArcNet*"

entry.title: Stop using StyleBuilder().InsideLink() as temporary storage.
entry.content:
We build up the InsideLink status inside the ComputedStyle pretty

early on; however, at this point, we don't actually conceptually

_have_ a ComputedStyle (we don't yet know whether we will be inheriting

from a partial MPC hit), and the value may get overwritten as we build

one.



Furthermore, as we evolve the ComputedStyleBuilder pattern, we might

not even have a provisional ComputedStyle at this point (we want to

delay constructing ComputedStyle until we know what we are to copy

from).



Thus, compute InsideLink from the StyleResolverState instead, on-demand

but cached. This allows us to set it only once, at the very end.



Change-Id: I80a1f6b409d6c8b86deb147344163cc782a5ced6

entry.title: Fix race condition for `PrefsAshObserver` for profile prefs
entry.content:
This CL fixes a race condition for profile prefs that are observed

on Lacros through the `PrefsAshObserver`. This observer was so far

only used for local state prefs. The race condition occurs when

a user pref value is sent through crosapi to lacros that is assigned

to a user profile. By the time the pref-changed event arrives, there

is no profile created yet and therefore the

`ProfileManager::GetPrimaryUserProfile` function used previously will

create a profile. In the call-stack, this will trigger loading of

other user prefs that have not yet been registered.



This CL fixes the problem by caching the received values and

propagating them as soon as the profile is initialized (i.e. in the

`PostProfileInit` callback).



Bug: 1459027

Change-Id: I165440c76b549df6e914160946b1fd4388ddb448

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4665583

Reviewed-by: Erik Chen

Commit-Queue: Simon Hangl

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1166338}

entry.title: Revert "[VoiceIsolation] Add new stream effect VoiceIsolation."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 6eac3ae3f0b40f0fdcc292b77549405dbfbfb402.



Reason for revert: build break: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/chromeos-kevin-chrome/27478/overview



Original change's description:

> [VoiceIsolation] Add new stream effect VoiceIsolation.

>

> New api introduced to provide the options to force turn on/off system

> voice isolation(NC) effect and check the platform availability.

>

> The control will be a tri-state composed of two bits(browser_controlled_{effect}, {effect}).

> !browser_controlled_{effect}: leave as platform default.

> browser_controlled_{effect} && {effect}: force enable platform {effect}

> browser_controlled_{effect} && !{effect}: force disable platform {effect}

>

> Design: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1a1zy_wYTgKhaPIAZ53lR8Y1RQzuzhND_kV7PLlP5WzE/edit?resourcekey=0-snrCqjLZrU8Bt9V0kW2hZA#heading=h.c0uts5ftkk58

entry.title: Use FixedFlatSet to store the set of app type names.
entry.content:
Since this set is never mutated after initialization, it is just a fixed

lookup table. FixedFlatSet provides a much more compact representation

than std::set and requires no heap allocations at all.

entry.title: [ntp-journeys] NTP history_clusters refactor
entry.content:
Refactors certain history clusters functions and logic so that the V1

and upcoming V2 Journeys modules can use different cluster query filter

parameters.



Sets the `CreateFilterParamsFromFeatureFlags` function to filter `done`

and `hidden` clusters true by default. Should result in no changes to

the currently returned cluster data by the service. This is because

at the current time, the history clusters module service filters too

any `hidden` or `done` clusters from the query results via the

`OnGetFilteredClusters` function.



Bug: 1443637

entry.title: arc: net: Restrict multicast traffic when not needed (1/2)
entry.content:
Excessive unnecessary multicast traffic would have consequential

impact on excessive CPU usage and shorter battery life.



This patch restrict multicast traffic to ARC when it is unnecessary

under the condition that:

1. Device is not interactive, when network is restricted overall.

2. Multicast lock is not held by any app in ARC when no app shows

interest in multicast traffic, we can stop forwarding multicast traffic

to ARC.



This patch does following things:

Sends device power state to patchpanel when it changes or when

ArcPowerBridge is ready



Platform side patch: https://crrev.com/c/4421722

ARC side patch: http://ag/22641743



BUG=b:274864026,b:273178045

TEST=tast run arc.DisableUnneededMulticastForwarder.*



arc: net: Update net.mojom and add call to notify multicast lock state



This patch updates ARC net.mojom with the new RPC needed for

implementing multicast traffic control using ARC multicast lock

by notifying Chrome about change in multicast lock held status.



BUG=b:274864026,b:273178045

TEST=autoninja -C out/Release chrome chrome_sandbox nacl_helper



Change-Id: Ia77f7cf125de32025189368e4dc507d7f4d3b1bb

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Some functions should return logical values
entry.content:
This CL updates OffsetFromColumnSet(), CalculateOverflow(), and

ColumnRectAt() methods of MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup so that they

return LogicalOffset, LogicalRect, and LogicalRect respectively. They

used to return flipped block-flow values.



The following functions handles points in the flipped block-flow

coordinate system, and this CL adds some adjustment code. We'll

remove them later.

* LayoutMultiColumnSet::VisualPointToFlowThreadPoint()

* MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup::VisualPointToFlowThreadPoint()

entry.title: [RemoveLegacy] Remove LayoutRect usages for FlowThreadPortion*RectAt()
entry.content:
FlowThreadPortionRectAt() and FlowThreadPortionOverflowRectAt() of

MultiColumnFragmentainerGroup class returned flipped block-flow

rectangles represented in LayoutRect. This CL changes them so that

they return PhysicalRects. We don't need to flip their results any

longer.



* Add LogicalFlowThreadPortionRectAt(). It's useful for computation

in FlowThreadPortion*RectAt().



* FragmentainerIterator::ClipRectInFlowThread() should return a

PhysicalRect. It's a result of FlowThreadPortion*RectAt().



* Remove unused FragmentainerIterator::flow_thread_.



* LogicalRect has ShiftBlock{Start,End}EdgeTo(). It's similar to

Shift*EdgeTo() methods of LayoutRect.



This CL should have no behavior chagnes.



Bug: 1229581

Change-Id: Id65a89170ec626d676a719039cd283ef2a2f9655
